title: Customer Discovery Interview with a Family Member of a Patient with Dementia

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: Hi, I'm really struggling to manage my relative's medical appointments. They often forget when and where to go.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER_SERVICE
dialogue.content: That sounds very challenging. Could you tell me more about the typical issues you face with their appointments?

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: Sure. Sometimes they forget the time of the appointment completely, and often they don't know what documents they need to bring.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER_SERVICE
dialogue.content: I see. How do you currently remind them of their appointments?

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: I try to call them or send them messages, but they often can't remember the information or get confused.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER_SERVICE
dialogue.content: That must be frustrating. Do they recognize the clinic when you arrive?

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: Not always. Sometimes they forget the way or the name of the clinic, so we spend a lot of time just trying to find the right place.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER_SERVICE
dialogue.content: How do you handle it when they can't remember where to go?

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: I usually have to go with them, but I have a busy schedule, and my siblings are also busy.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER_SERVICE
dialogue.content: Have you ever considered using any kind of reminders or technology to assist with this?

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: I've thought about it, but Iâ€™m not sure which tools would work best for someone with dementia.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER_SERVICE
dialogue.content: What kind of support do you think would help you the most in this situation?

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: Maybe having someone who could assist us at the clinic would be helpful. Just someone who knows what to do.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER_SERVICE
dialogue.content: That sounds like a great idea. Would you prefer this assistance to be available on-site at the clinic or remotely through a phone app or service?

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: On-site would be best since they need physical help navigating.

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER_SERVICE
dialogue.content: Thank you for sharing this with me. Is there anything else that you think could improve the experience for both you and your relative?

dialogue.speaker: CLIENT
dialogue.content: Just having clearer communication from the clinic about what they need and when would really help as well.
